comments:
We rely on having a source name and package name.
Source name can be null.

*** Bug 10066 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Workaround is to turn off the 'suspend on compilation errors' preference.

Please verify (Darin S). If the source name is not available, we "guess" at the 
source name by looking at the declaring type name. This will only fail for top 
level non public types for which no debug attributes are available (which is 
acceptable).

I tested by turning of the "source name" compiler option.
